data.title: Golub Capital BDC declares $0.39 dividend
data.description:
• Golub Capital BDC (NASDAQ:GBDC) declares $0.39/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous.
  • Forward yield 9.96%
  • Payable March 28; for shareholders of record March 3; ex-div March 3.
  • See GBDC Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.

data.title: Adicet Bio receives FDA fast track designation for its lupus erythematosus treatment
data.description:
• Adicet Bio (NASDAQ:ACET) announced the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has granted Fast Track Designation to ADI-001 for the potential treatment of adult patients with refractory systemic lupus erythematosus with extrarenal involvement.
  • ACET shares up about 11% premarket.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: Giftify cancels equity line of credit
data.description:
• Giftify (NASDAQ:GIFT), the owner and operator of leading digital platforms, CardCash.com and Restaurant.com, has announced the cancellation of its equity line of credit.
  • On Dec. 16, 2024, the Co. entered into a common stock purchase agreement with an institutional investor.
  • Pursuant to the SPA, the Co. had the right, but not the obligation, to sell to the Investor, up to $10M of newly issued shares of the Co.’s common stock, subject to certain limitations and conditions.
  • The Co. has exercised its right to terminate the SPA effective Feb. 4, 2025, by mutual agreement of the parties.

data.title: U.S. Treasury offering $125B of securities in quarterly refunding
data.description:
The U.S. Treasury is offering $125B of Treasury securities to refund ~$106.2B of privately held Treasury notes and bonds maturing on Feb. 15, 2025, it said in a statement on Wednesday. The issuance will raise new cash from private investors of ~$18.8B.

The securities are:

  • A three-year note in the amount of $58B, maturing Feb. 15, 2028 to be auctioned on Feb. 11;
  • A 10-year note in the amount of $42B, maturing Feb. 15, 2035 to be auctioned on Feb. 12; and
  • A 30-year bond in the amount of $25B, maturing Feb. 15, 2055 to be auctioned on Feb. 13.

In morning trading, the U.S. 10-year Treasury yield (US10Y) fell 5 basis points to 4.46%.

Based on its current projected borrowing needs, the Treasury anticipates maintaining nominal coupon and floating rate note auction sizes for at least the next several quarters, it said.

data.title: Pitney Bowes SendPro 360 platform achieves StateRAMP security authorization
data.description:
• Pitney Bowes (NYSE:PBI) has achieved US State Risk and Authorization Management Program authorization for the SendPro® 360 solution, its next-generation sending and receiving platform.
  • This achievement reflects the company’s unwavering commitment to delivering a secure and reliable solution that government agencies can rely on to safeguard their data and operations and enforce overall Agency cloud policy.
  • The SendPro 360 platform provides government agencies with secure access to a suite of inbound and outbound shipping solutions, all backed by comprehensive analytics available across the entire platform.
  • The StateRAMP authorized SendPro 360 platform reaffirms that government agencies and organizations can confidently rely on Pitney Bowes to streamline their operations, reduce risk, and enhance data security.

data.title: U.S. trade deficit widens more than expected in December
data.description: The U.S.'s international trade in goods and services deficit jumped to $98.4B M/M in December, vs. slightly larger than the $96.5B shortfall expected, from $78.9B in the previous month (revised from $78.2B), according to the Census Bureau data released on Wednesday.

data.title: Air Industries Group announces the pay down of $1M of subordinated debt
data.description:
• Air Industries Group (NYSE:AIRI) has announced it has repaid more than $1M of its subordinated debt.
  • “We expect to make additional repayments in the coming months. Our goal is to substantially reduce the remaining subordinated debt while continuing to grow and enhance the profitability of the business.” said Lou Melluzzo, CEO of Air Industries Group.

data.title: Uber shares weighed down by bookings outlook, FX headwinds
data.description:
Uber Technologies (NYSE:UBER) shares were weighed down in Wednesday’s premarket trading as the company’s impressive Q4 bookings and revenue growth were overshadowed by a slight miss in anticipated bookings growth and adjusted EBITDA for the current quarter.

In Q4, Uber (NYSE:UBER) increased gross bookings by 18% from a year ago to $44.2B with mobility gross bookings and delivery gross bookings both up 18%, year-over-year, respectively. This contributed to a 20% gain in total revenue to $12.0B, beating Wall Street’s expectations by $190M.

“Uber ended 2024 with our strongest quarter ever, as growth accelerated across MAPCs, trips, and Gross Bookings,” CEO Dara Khosrowshahi said, adding that the company’s performance was powered by rapid innovation and execution across multiple priorities.

“We enter 2025 with clear momentum and will continue to be relentless against our long-term strategy,” he added.

While there were certainly signs of significant progress for the ride-sharing company, investors seemed to be more concerned with currency headwinds that will likely dampen growth for the current quarter.

Uber (NYSE:UBER) projected Q1 gross bookings to be between $42B to $43.5B, translating into a midpoint of $42.8B, below the consensus forecast of $43.5B. Additionally, the midpoint of the adjusted EBITDA range of $1.79B and $1.89B is also slightly below consensus estimates of $1.85B.

In addition, for the reported quarter, the company’s profit swelled to $6.9B, or $3.21 per share, but was largely attributed to a $6.4B tax valuation adjustment. Instead, adjusted EBITDA of $1.84B missed the consensus estimate of $1.85B, while operating income of $770M also missed the consensus estimate of $1.15B.

Uber (UBER) shares were down as much as 10% on the initial reaction to the results, but have since recouped some losses, down 5% in premarket. Lyft (LYFT) shares are down 2.6% in sympathy.

data.title: MACOM European Semiconductor Center awarded contract
data.description:
• MACOM Technology Solutions (NASDAQ:MTSI) said on Wednesday that it has been awarded a multi-year contract from Banque Publique d'Investissement to lead the development and manufacturing of advanced semiconductor products, in collaboration with public and private sector partners.
  • The ‘MAGENTA’ program’s goal is to develop next generation Ka-band Monolithic Microwave Integrated Circuit front end products, leveraging MESC’s existing Gallium Nitride technology.
  • The MAGENTA program is financed by the French government within the framework of France 2030 and will be administered by BPI, the French agency for innovation and a financial institution.
  • Under the terms of the contract, MESC will lead manufacturing of the MMICs developed by MAGENTA partners.

data.title: Embraer’s stock jumps on record $7B order from Flexjet
data.description:
Embraer’s (NYSE:ERJ) shares rose 6.9% in premarket trading Wednesday after the Brazilian plane maker said Flexjet agreed to spend as much as $7 billion on business jets, the biggest order in history for the provider of shared jet ownership.

Embraer Executive Jets, a unit of Embraer (NYSE:ERJ), said the agreement includes the Praetor 600, Praetor 500 and Phenom 300E models, as well as services and support. The agreement includes a firm order for 182 aircraft and options for another 30.
